You know, some of the things that you already talked about, there's a BBC documentary called Dead in the Water.
It's one of the things that it said is what you said earlier, Phil, which is,
Hey, if the Israelis could get the Americans into this war in a big way, you know,
that can really help us out against these Arabs is what Israeli was thinking.
And these kind of things happen.
What is, what, what do you guys do with the LVA now?
What's, what's the purpose?
How can people help?
Well, one of the things that we're still trying to do is get recognition for our 34 fall and shipmates.
We've tried over the years to get Congress to conduct a fallen and partial investigation,
and it's fallen on deaf ears.
Right now, we've got a resolution going forward to ask for June 8th to be declared as US Liberty Remembrance Day.
It should be a fairly simple thing for Congress to do.
I mean, we have National Hot Dog Day, National Ice Cream Day,
but let's have a National USS Liberty Remembrance Day.
And not just one year, but every year, June 8th.
So we're working on that.
I've got a resolution in the state of New York going through the American Legion up there
to have that presented through their channels.
I'm in a process of doing it in a state of Maryland.
I'm working with a former Senator Pete McCluskey to get a petition out to get signatures for people
that will support the establishment of June 8th as US Liberty Remembrance Day.
And then present that to various legislators to show them that,
hey, the American public wants to know.
They need to know.
And, you know, if nothing else, you're honoring the 34 men that gave the ultimate sacrifice back on June 8th, 1967.
When you talk about some of the awards that were received,
most every one of us that received any kind of an award,
Purple Heart or Prons Star, you know, the Congressional Medal of Honor,
it was all done in private.
There were no big ceremonies like you would normally expect for, you know,
someone with that just came off the most decorated ship in the United States Navy since World War II.
And, you know, 95% of the American public is not even aware of it.
